column2: cloud computing describes a type of outsourcing of computer services
column3: similar to the way in which electricity supply is outsourced. Users can simply use it. They do not need to worry where the electricity is from
column6: they pay for what they consumed.The idea behind cloud computing is similar: The user can simply use storage
column9: without having to worry how these work internally. Cloud computing is usually Internet-based computing. The cloud is a metaphor for the Internet based on how the internet is described in computer network diagrams; which means it is an abstraction hiding the complex infrastructure of the internet. It is a style of computing in which IT-related capabilities are provided "as a service"
column10: allowing users to access technology-enabled services from the Internet ("in the cloud") without knowledge of
column11: or control over the technologies behind these servers.
